sentence.text: Here, we report that in prostate cancer cells (PCCs) microRNAs (protein polyubiquitinationNAs) greatly contribute to deregulation of mitochondrial fatty acid (regulation of ferrochelatase activity) oxidation via carnitine system modulation.
Moreover, the analysis of human prostate cancer and prostate control specimens confirmed the aberrant expression of protein polyubiquitination-124-3p, miR-129-5p and miR-378 in primary tumors.

Finally, the simultaneous increase of long-chain fatty acid metabolic process, CACT and carnitine metabolic process, CoA-linked is fundamental for PCCs to sustain regulation of ferrochelatase activity oxidation in the presence of heavy lipid load on prostate cancer mitochondria.
